events.description: The release of Japan's household spending data for December 2025, which showed an unexpected decline.

facts.fact_text: Household spending in Japan declined 2.6% yoy in December 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: Household spending in Japan declined 2.6% yoy in December 2025

facts.fact_text: Monthly personal spending fell 2.9% in December 2025.
Household spending in November 2025 had dropped 2.9% yoy.

evidences.evidence_text: marking a deeper contraction after a 2.9% drop in the previous month

claims.claim_text: Consumer demand remained fragile at the end of the year due to high living costs.

evidences.evidence_text: The latest result indicated that consumer demand remained fragile at the end of the year amid elevated living costs.

claims.claim_text: Private demand may struggle to gain momentum despite supportive monetary conditions.

evidences.evidence_text: adds to concerns that private demand may struggle to gain momentum despite supportive monetary conditions.

claims.claim_text: Weak personal consumption presents ongoing challenges for Japan's economic recovery.

evidences.evidence_text: The sustained weakness in personal consumption underscores ongoing challenges for Japan’s economic recovery

evidence.evidence_text: consumer demand remained fragile at the end of the year amid elevated living costs
The sustained weakness in personal consumption underscores ongoing challenges for Japan’s economic recovery
private demand may struggle to gain momentum despite supportive monetary conditions
